lines.text: Wake me up when it's time to die.
Are you scared of dyin', Lou?
Not particularly. It just comes an inconvenient time.
Where are you from?
Anywhere I happen to be.
Tell me Señor, are you as bad as they say?
No man is as bad as they say, Señorita.
It will be wonderful to dine instead of to feed. It seems to be the routine when men in a country like this are isolated. I miss the conversation... the eloquence of dining in mixed company.

I've discovered, Mr. Chuka, that to a savage kindness means weakness. He'll despise you for it. The moment you turn your back, he'll put a knife in it. I offer you that piece of intelligence. It might save your life someday.

Colonel, they're awful hungry out there. I think they're mean. And unless you give them food or the rifles to hunt their own, they're gonna come in here and *take* it. That's a little piece of intelligence that might save *your* life sometime.
How many men have you killed?
I stopped counting at sixteen.
Were they fair fights? Mr. Chuka! Where they fair fights?
Fifteen were fair.
And what is fair to you, Mr. Chuka
They were facing me. They had a chance at me.
And the sixteenth?
I shot him in the back of the head. But like the doctor here, I can't prove that he stuck a knife in me and was stealing my horse.
Please don't allow the actions and therefore the discipline of one man to disturb you.
In a lifetime, Colonel Valois, I have learned that one man is the image of all men.
You have become quite hard.
Since I didn't measure up to your standards in life, madame, I had to find a way to bring people down to mine.
With your gun, I hear, Senor Chuka.
With my gun, Senora Kleits
Now you can pull that gun of yours and shoot me where I stand, or you can defend yourself as best you can, because I intend to beat you into the ground with my fists. Now, I'm waiting on ya!
You reek of whiskey, Trent! Not exactly the quality one looks for in a Chief Scout.
